intro: Seselopsis tianschanica, commonly known as the Tianshan seselopsis, is a perennial herb native to the Tianshan mountain range in Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
